intro: Phlogacanthus vitellinus, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy yellow or orange bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid environments. It is often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in subtropical climates.
